physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Best-corrected visual acuity was 20/150 in each eye monocularly and 20/100 binocularly; small-angle exophoria with decreased stereopsis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Approximately 13 months later, visual acuity decreased to 20/400 bilaterally; developed horizontal nystagmus; sensory testing normal but strength testing decreased for age; bilateral dysmetria and prominent ataxia observed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ocular examination 18 months after riboflavin treatment showed improvement in visual acuity to 20/20 bilaterally; complete resolution of nystagmus.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Neurologic examination demonstrated improved coordination, gait, and muscle strength after treatment.
